comments_since_last_sample.body: My favourite was the little star made from the sweater. It looked so cute as a topper! And whoever gets it can use it as a tree ornament year after year! Can you do some more like that? That'd be awesome! Thanks for sharing another helpful and beautiful video ❤
I love the mason jar sweaters!
Everything turned out very beautiful and I enjoyed all of them, but I have to say the French horn swag was my absolute favorite. 🌹
Christina you sure know how to make everything special and unique. I learn a lot from you! Thank you and have a great day! ❤

Maybe for your string on the horn...to keep it looking a bit cleaner...use longer string ( like a double loop) and tie it at the horn only...then cover it with ribbon or small flowers like baby's breathe.

You are so gifted and creative! I love watching your diy's. I loved the french horn project. I had one of those and purged it one year when I needed to let go of some Christmas decor. Now I wish I had it. I'll have to keep an eye out for one at a thrift store and make a decor piece like yours.
I just loved the bowl and French horn! Well done.
Thanks for the fab video ❤️
That French horn swag is gorgeous!
Great ideas thank you !
Love watching all of your creative ideas. They are all so beautiful, I agree with you the French horn was my favorite.
Lovely crafts!
Great decor, I love that you got so much at the thrift store. Love the music pages, and the wood bowl.
I’m so loving the wood bowl !!! I wish I had a value village.
Love them all! Now I need to go thrifting! :)
I am a bit of a bookworm so I really like the book stack...but as usual, these are all great ideas. Thanks Christina.
All of these thrifted up cycled crafts are so beautiful! It’s hard to pick a favourite! They all make gorgeous, unique Christmas decor! Such great ideas!
Still not ready for the holidays, but these are great ideas!
Wonderful ideas! Thank you. My favorite-the mason jars with thrifted sweater😊
Gorgeous!
